sections.title: About Willing Hands
sections.content: Willing Hands uses an open, relaxed posture to reduce resistance and help your body shift from tension to calm. By opening your hands—palms up or forward, depending on whether you're sitting, standing, or lying down—you signal your brain to soften anger and frustration. This simple posture interrupts physical tension and supports acceptance during emotionally intense moments.

sections.title: Example
sections.content: Remi was lying in bed, tense and overwhelmed by racing thoughts. Using Willing Hands, they placed their arms by their sides with palms up, relaxed their fingers, and took slow breaths. As they softened the physical tension and reminded themselves, "I don't need to control everything right now," the frustration eased and they became calm enough to rest.

sections.title: Remember
sections.content: Willing Hands isn't about approval of difficult situations—it's about creating space to respond wisely instead of reacting impulsively. This simple posture can help shift your mindset when you're feeling resistance.
